channel.title: Apple on PR
channel.description: Recent content in Apple on PR

item.title: Book Recommendations
item.description: I was too lazy to write blog post for a long time. To break my lazy streak, here is something I wanted to write and procrastinated for at-least 6 months.

item.title: Dev Diary: Apple Pay
item.description: I’ve recently integrated Apple Pay for an iOS app. Though I have heard it is very easy to integrate and lot of tutorials available, I could not find overall requirements/activities involved in integrating Apple Pay.

item.title: Speedy
item.description: Speedy is a Speed reading application for Mac OS X that lets you speed read the text contents. It is based on speed reading technique/methodology called Spritz

item.title: Speedy - Speed reading application for Mac
item.description: Speedy is an utility application for Mac OS X that lets you speed read the text contents. I created to read the emails & news faster, as I have a tendency to lost in ‘endless space between the words’ with my lack of concentration or I should say gift of imagination?

item.title: iPad Pro and Apple
item.description: Last Sunday, I got to try iPad pro with all its accessories (most of the outlet here has only iPad pro without keyboard & pencil).

item.title: Functional Special characters in Mavericks
item.description: I was one of the very few people who held on to the last cat OS X (Mountain Lion). I had to switch to Mavericks at office to play with the new shiny language Swift.

item.title: WWDC'13 - Hidden Gems in Cocoa and Cocoa Touch
item.description: If you did not have enough time to go through the 50G contents from WWDC’13, I highly recommend you to watch the session 228, aptly named “Hidden Gems in Cocoa and Cocoa Touch”.

item.title: Laptop Cooling Pad & Sudden Motion Sensor
item.description: Finally I found a good usecase to test the Sudden Motion Sensor of my macbook pro. I was curious to know whether there is an impact of cooling pad’s fan.

item.title: Expired distribution provisioning and Yak shaving
item.description: Last Thursday one of my iPad app’s provisioning file has expired. Client brought it to us at the very late moment, the iPad app was distributed internally as an enterprise app.

item.title: Failed to get brightness for displayID
item.description: If you are experiencing frequent disk I/O and your console is full of 25/08/12 4:30:19.506 PM ALSPlugin 235.55[62]: Failed to get brightness for displayID 0x042731c0

item.title: RIP - My Macbook Pro (13" Mid 2010)
item.description: TL;DR If you have a Apple Portable within the 1yr manf. warranty, stop reading and go and buy Apple care if you haven’t already.

item.title: Idea Vault: iBooks 3.0
item.description: The idea supposed to be named as iBooks 2.0 well it is taken by Apple yesterday :) The original pointers of this idea from my notebook are

item.title: iCloud Gotchas
item.description: Integrating iCloud with core data was easy when I found this tutorial, but I ran into few issues while implementing and testing it on devices.

item.title: Installing more simulators for xcode 4.2 without re-downloading everytime
item.description: If you are like me, who use more than one machine to develop iOS app and wants to install 4.

item.title: BTServer CPU Usage
item.description: I recently uninstalled all previous versions of xcode (I had all xcode from ios 3.2.x) to install 4.2 on my MBP.

item.title: mclock - Additional clock application for mac menu bar
item.description: Update (2016-01-20): The app is now available on Mac App store. Additional menu clock for your Mac. A minimalist clock to display time of different timezone of your choice.

item.title: RIP - Steven P. Jobs
item.description: The people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do.

item.title: iTunes 10 Logo
item.description: End credits from the movie Up iTunes logo updated with version 10 in Sep ‘10

item.title: Distribute your iPhone/iPad adhoc builds Over The Air using Dropbox
item.description: Update: I recently found this site called diawi.com which allows you to distribute the app similar to file-sharing sites, drag and drop ipa file and share the link to the testers.

item.title: Enter into / Exit from Recovery mode for iPhone
item.description: Yes, every post you come across suggest the same thing, hold your power button and home button for X seconds. Though it is true, unfortunately I had a couple of situations my iphone doesn’t respond to the key combinations.

item.title: Advanced iPhone Development - iTunesU
item.description: Recent search on iTunes listed the Madison Area Technical College classes on iPhone development by Dr. Brad Larson Session on OpenGL ES 2.

item.title: Custom UISplitViewController now available on GitHub
item.description: I created this custom UISplitViewController as one of my iPad project required Split view for only one screen. The default UISplitViewController provided by Apple can only be added to UIWindow which means you can’t use it with normal UINavigation based project with only one splitview screen.

item.title: Mac App Store - Source
item.description: You get the idea? You are not looking for the UI code are you? Saurik will be doing the UI for us ;)

item.title: Apple Sep 1, 2010 Event under 3 min
item.description: Youtube link Content requires Javascript to be enabled. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-24euRgImPg p.noscript{ background-color: #fefea0; border-left: 4px solid #fea0a0; padding: 0 0.

item.title: Call Me A Hypocrite: My take on Apple Event Sep 1, 2010 - Part II
item.description: iTunes 10 Another iTunes upgrade, I don’t want to see another 100Mb iTunes upgrade till next month. Many people were fighting over the icon, Guys!

item.title: Call Me A Hypocrite: My take on Apple Event Sep 1, 2010 - Part I
item.description: Only yesterday I got a chance to view the Keynote video. You can also download the video from iTunes for Free.

item.title: iPad - Safari background texture
item.description: TL;DR Apple version of the texture background_linen.png Ever since I installed the iOS 3.2 SDK I was in love with the iPad/Safari background fabric texture.

item.title: Snow Leopard (Retail) on Lenovo 3000 N100
item.description: Disclaimer: There is no alternative to real Mac, if you like Mac go and buy it. If buying a real Mac is too much, you can at least buy a license for Mac OS X Snow Leopard which costs $29 only.

item.title: Angry Birds – I give up
item.description: Angry Birds is one great app in Apple App Store that worth every penny (Full version is only $0.99)

item.title: WWDC 2010 - iPhone 4
item.description: iPad didn’t replace common tasks. Steve was referring his notepad on stage:). Old habits die hard. Steve can still memorize 24 countries and repeat them in the same order.

item.title: Download Apple WWDC Keynote videos
item.description: I was always disappointed with Apple Keynote pages. It allows you to stream and watch the videos with QuickTime which is not great for streaming and videos are not HTML5 yet.

item.title: iPad - My Experience
item.description: Warning: My observations are biased as I’m not an Apple Fanboy, at least right now (was one in the past, I both respect and hate Apple & Microsoft)

item.title: Solving Read-Only Notes.app issue
item.description: Notes.app of miPhone was not allowing me to save any new notes. This was after restoring the manual backup of notes.

item.title: Obj-C | For beginners
item.description: A quick obj-c cheat-sheet for the beginners. Scribd link This is taken from RWTH-iPhone Application Programming. You can also download complete videos from iTunesU.

item.title: [BEROR]Code Sign error: Provisioning profile '579ACFD8-827A-4325-F623-DB8CDD5081DB' can't be found
item.description: Check dependencies Code Sign error: Provisioning profile [BEROR]Code Sign error: Provisioning profile ‘579ACFD8-827A-4325-F623-DB8CDD5081DB’ can’t be found Anyone who is relatively new to iPhone development could easily identify this issue is related to the invalid provisioning profile.

item.title: Why AppStore submission process sucks!
item.description: They only check the binary to see if they use any private API nothing other than that. Sometimes they reject the app and give you a reason that it doesn’t fit with their HIG standards.

item.title: iPhone – Accessibility
item.description:
What if iPhone provides an accessibility option for users with bigger finger?
I found that pinch to zoom and screenshot capturing can be considered as good photo cropping tool.

item.title: How to Register iTunes Account for Free (In Any Country Without A Credit Card)
item.description: Follow the steps below: Launch iTunes Log out of your account (if any) Scroll down the iTunes page and hit the flag on the right Select your country of interest Try to buy a random free app (Note: You will see payment option None only when you register after/while downloading a free app) iTunes will ask you for your credentials, hit open a new account Accept the terms Enter a valid email, pick a password and so on.
